intro: Medinilla negrosensis, commonly known as the Negros medinilla, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has thick, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture in its tropical habitat. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and is found in lowland rainforests. Medinilla negrosensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and shelter for small fauna.
